revised_title: Exploring the Structure and Filtration Capabilities of Collodion Gel Films
tldr: The authors investigate the structure and filtration capabilities of collodion gel films, specifically focusing on acetic acid collodion membranes. They discover that the structure of these films varies depending on the concentration of nitrocellulose and that the rate of flow of water through these membranes is not inversely proportional to their thickness. This research contributes to a better understanding of filtration and filterable viruses.
